top_categories.workout_context: Gravel Suisse rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Gravel Suisse’s swiss alpine gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Gravel Suisse when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Gravel Suisse’s swiss alps, alpine gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Gravel Suisse isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Gravel Suisse. Make this intensity feel like home.
Gravel Suisse’s 5,500ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Gravel Suisse’s swiss alpine gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Gravel Suisse’s 5,500ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Gravel Suisse — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Every session at Gravel Suisse intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Gravel Suisse — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on swiss alpine gravel.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Gravel Suisse’s 65 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Gravel Suisse. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Gravel Suisse requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on swiss alpine gravel to build confidence. Expect: swiss alps, alpine gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, VO2max, and Over Under to prepare you for 65 miles of swiss alpine gravel in Aigle, Switzerland.
